File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_ArabellaPowers_PAD_ArabellaLeftLetter.lsj
Synopsis:
PAD that plays after the player read Arabella's letter in Act 3 Camp, telling them she has gone off to find her own way. Players will get different lines depending on if they resolved her Act 2 quest line fully by having her have a heart to heart with Jergal after losing her parents or not. Bad version text: [The ink is still fresh, and the letter is drawn in a careful hand.]

So I guess I shouldn't be too mad. I mean, I'm not snake food thanks to you. But I still thought you'd be helping me out, finding my parents and stuff...

Don't matter though really, does it? The curse took them, or maybe one of those cultist creeps. I got to accept that. Just like I got to accept I'm on my own now. But don't you go worrying, Bone Man said the weave'll guide me. Don't know what that means, exactly, but I'll figure it out.

- Arabella Good version text:[The ink is still fresh, and the letter is drawn in a careful hand.]

Hey you. So, I owe you a lot. For one, I don't know what the inside of a snake's belly looks like. For another, you let me stay at your camp. And for ANOTHER another, you found out what happened to moms and pops.

I'm on my own now and Bone Man says it's a good thing. I just have to let the Weave guide me. And as far as I can tell, it's tugging me to Baldur's Gate, so I'm headed there first.

Anyway, thanks for everything. I won't forget it.

- Arabella

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Patch1_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_Halsin2.lsj
Synopsis:
Halsin's default dialogue at camp once he's joined you as a follower. You can ask how he's faring in your company, as well as glean some details about your next quest. Halsin is avuncular and scholarly, but his mood grows darker whenever he speaks of Moonrise Towers and the curse that has shrouded it. Once Thaniel, the spirit of the land, has been rescued and brought to camp, a new branch will unlock where Halsin can explain that Thaniel's heart is missing, and it needs to be retrieved in order for the Shadow curse to be lifted. Halsin can be recruited as a companion 11from then on.

0:0 - Perhaps if I manage to break the curse... perhaps then I can show you just how grateful I am.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_Jergal.lsj
Synopsis:
Jergal, a god of the dead, awaits the player in camp. He is bound by the judgment of another god - Helm - to assist the players as penance for past crimes. He provides resurrection services to the players.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_OathbreakerKnight.lsj
Synopsis:
When a paladin becomes an oathbreaker the Oathbreaker knight will appear to be their guide. He will stay at the camp as a camp follower. If a non-oathbreaker paladin speaks to the Oathbreaker, they begin a short interactive dialogue. The Oathbreaker is mildly impressed that they are still dedicated to their cause, but warns that the course ahead will test their commitment.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_OathbreakerKnight_PlayerIsNotPaladin.lsj
Synopsis:
When a player from a class other than a paladin tries to speak with the Oathbtreaker Knight he will not want to start a conversation. From design: Any non-paladin character talking to the Oathbreaker receives no reply. The Oathbreaker looks up at the character, but shakes their head - they have no interest in you.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_OwlbearCub.lsj
Synopsis:
Default dialogue with the owlbear cub in the player's camp - available after the events of CAMP_OwlbearCub_CFM_Dog. The player can pet the cub, ask some SwA questions and learn what happened during the previous CFM if they opted to quit the dialogue early (what sounded like the owlbear cub attacking the dog was actually the cub having a bad dream and the dog comforting him).

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_LaezelRomance2_AD_LaezelOnAvatarUsingItems.lsj
Synopsis:
Laezel remarks that using items is cheating in a duel like this. But she brushes it off in the end. We don't have reactivity in the romance scene to cover for the player cheating, so this should be very light and playful rather than blaming. Added because Laezel will be blocked from using items during the fight as we don't want her to deplete the player's resources.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_Minthara.lsj
Synopsis:
Minthara, now freed from the influence of the Absolute and from a jail cell at Moonrise Towers, joins the players' party at their Camp. She is shaken from her experiences, and is coming to terms with the fact that she now understands the truth about the Absolute - that it is not a god at all, but something monstrous that lies within Moonrise. She wishes to join with the party, knowing they can help her get vengeance against the cult, and knowing that they are her only hope of salvation, thanks to the Prism that they hold, which shuts out the Absolute's voice.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_RestReminder_PAD.lsj
Synopsis:
PAD for players that go too long without returning to camp to rest. There's no status penalty, this is just a verbal reminder that their characters should rest soon. Triggers after every third combat, once you leave the danger zone.

0:0 - I need to rest. Sunset can't come quickly enough.
0:1 - Ugh. There had better be a soft bedroll in my near future.
0:2 - I'm so tired. How do people do this all day?
1:0 - I'm quite exhausted. A good night's sleep would do me wonders.
1:1 - If I don't get my beauty sleep soon, I may just get a tad malcontent.
1:2 - A wizard's quite worthless with a tired mind. Sleep beckons, and I would follow.
2:0 - My dogs are barking. Can we rest?
2:1 - *Yawn!*
2:2 - Time to take a load off, isn't it?
2:3 - I am ready to rest my weary head.
3:0 - Battle has taken its toll. I should rest.
3:1 - My energy wanes - time to rest.
3:2 - My eyes grow heavy. Best to make camp.
4:0 - It's been a long day. Better stop to rest soon.
4:1 - Better make camp soon. Might be a while before there's another chance to rest.
4:2 - Should get some rest - I need to keep sharp.
4:3 - Time to pack it in for the day, I think.
5:0 - What a day. I could really use some shut-eye.
5:1 - Whew - I'm spent. I should unwind in camp.
5:2 - What I wouldn't give for a good rest about now.
6:0 - I'm exhausted. Better find somewhere to camp soon.
6:1 - It's been a long day. I'll need to rest soon.
6:2 - I'm done. I can't wait to sleep.
uid: 1276de78-24e3-a364-8b36-2b96808e24e3
- 0:0 Tag: Custom - |Really Generic origin| (An enthusiastic adventurer of remarkable spirit and mettle.)

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_Shadowheart_CRD_WildMagic.lsj
Synopsis:
At camp, Shadowheart experiences a brief flare-up of mysterious magical energy, She reacts with alarm an utters the name of Shar, her patron goddess. If other party members are present, they ask her what just happened.

uid: feeedf94-16b8-e2e1-f682-533ed184ac98

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\Gustav\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_VoloOperation.lsj
Synopsis:
Volo is a canonical character in DnD. He's known for being the realm's go-to guy for compiling information. In this take, he fulfils that role but puts a twist on what he sees. He's keenly curious for facts but likes to embellish them. A bit like Gilderoy Lockheart. He IS talented, but his reputation has gotten away from him, too. In this dialogue, Volo will offer to put his knowledge at your service if you confide you've been infected with a mindflayer. He'll perform an icepick lobotomy that'll leave you without an eye or much in the way of apology from Volo. He should be clever, a little arrogant, very English, and very fun, without being a cartoon character.

0:0 - I'll need to research the particulars, however. Give me a bit of time, and I'll have this little issue sorted.
uid: 0160705f-88a6-fedb-d6b4-939d23d6dfb5
- 0 Check flag(s) (Global):
   false - GLO_Volo_State_Researched - GLO_Volo_State_Researcheddescription
- 0 Set flag(s) to (Global):
   true - GLO_Volo_State_Researching - GLO_Volo_State_Researchingdescription

0:0 - Stop? Now?!

> Yes. We're done here.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_VampireAmbush_PAD_AstarionKidnapped.lsj
Synopsis:
Astarion was kidnapped by vampire spawn who ambushed you at camp during the night (CAMP_VampireAmbush_SCO_Companion.lsj). The remaining member(s) of the party comment that they need to finish the long rest before trying to find him.

0:0 - Better save any rescue attempts until dawn. Darkness is no ally in the pursuit of such an enemy.
1:0 - Darkness is no time to mount a rescue. I can set out for Cazador's lair come dawn.
2:0 - I'd be a fool to go after Cazador before sunrise. For now, I should rest.
3:0 - We can't do anything until morning. Those vampire spawn will be in their element right now.
4:0 - But he won't have him for long. Come morning, those vamps are mine.

5:0 - But assaulting a vampire's stronghold by night will only land us in irons along with him. Better to wait 'til morning.
6:0 - We cannot safely pursue until daybreak - the night is their realm.
7:0 - We will follow, Boo - but not until the sunrise has the vampires snoozing in their upside-down beds.
8:0 - Vampires thrive in the darkness even more than I do. Best wait 'til morning before we strike.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_ShadowheartMother.lsj
Synopsis:
Default camp dialog for Shadowheart's mom. She has recovered somewhat from her ordeal in the Shar grotto, but will never truly heal - she's grown old in captivity, and she's prone to confusion at times. Still, she remains glad and supportive. She has unique branches for Shadowheart and non-Shadowheart players, as well as branches that occur before and after CAMP_Shadowheart_DaughterTears, in which SH and her parents have their first proper heart to heart.

File E:\BG3_Unpack\Gustav_pak\Mods\GustavDev\Story\Dialogs\Camp\CAMP_ShadowheartFather.lsj
Synopsis:
Default camp dialog for Shadowheart's dad. He has started to recover from her ordeal in the Shar grotto. He has unique branches for Shadowheart and non-Shadowheart players, as well as branches that occur before and after CAMP_Shadowheart_DaughterTears, in which SH and her parents have their first proper heart to heart following their reunion.

0:0 - I should gather my strength. I've waited so long for this, a little longer won't do any harm...
